climbs.name: Standard Desert Crack
climbs.fa: Robert Rowsam, Peter Blank, Mickey Guziak, May 18, 2019

content.description:
There may be a reason why this is one of the last big towers to be climbed in The Monument. This being said, it is one of the most incredible summits The Monument has to offer.

P1. We went up a cruddy chimney which exits a small roof (C2) and eases over to some 5.9 R (bad pro). The first half is possible to avoid but would require some unprotected traversing. Belay near a ledge with big cams.

P2. Walk left on a good ledge to connect with a beak seam which gains the upper crack system. Mixed aid/free with lots of hollow sounding (scary) flakes with good cracks (hands -#6) in the back. Pull through a kitty litter section, and continue up to a small roof. Some tricks and some smaller cams will get you to the summit.
content.protection: A standard desert rack and 2 x 70m ropes (one rappel).
content.location: Start in the obvious chimney on the northeast side of the tower. An old drill steel points you in the right direction.

climbs.name: I Can't Believe It's Not Better
climbs.fa: Mickey Guziak, Robert Rowsam, Peter Blank

content.description:
After a recon trip to Esoterica, we wanted to save time and scramble back to the rim. It turned out not to be the case....

P1. Start up a slot with mid-5th Class cracks. Go past a small tower on your right to the base of a gnarly chimney. This is a pretty good pitch.

P2. Go up an awesome chimney/OW. It's pretty wild up there and super adventury. This is an excellent pitch.

You are on a beautiful terrace with the hopes of an easy scramble out. Dreams are crushed here.

P3. Â Climb up and left across super sandy slabs with really no gear to speak of. Eventually you get into the next layer up and can scramble out from there. This is a serious and low percentage pitch.
content.location: It is just down canyon 100 yards or so from Esoterica Tower.
